title: Electronic Travel Authority (Business Entrant) (subclass 956 and 977)
summary: This page provides information for holders of the now‑closed Electronic Travel Authority (Business Entrant) visas, subclasses 956 and 977. It explains validity periods, permitted activities, obligations, and requirements for notifying changes in circumstances.

subclasses.description: Electronic Travel Authority (Business Entrant – long validity)
subclasses.status: Closed to new applications since 22 March 2013

subclasses.description: Electronic Travel Authority (Business Entrant – short validity)
subclasses.status: Closed to new applications since 22 March 2013

who_this_information_is_for: Holders of Electronic Travel Authority (Business Entrant – long validity) subclass 956
Holders of Electronic Travel Authority (Business Entrant – short validity) subclass 977

general_notes.vevo_availability: Eligible holders can check their ETA status and entitlements using Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free.

subclass_956.stay_duration: Up to 3 months on each visit

subclass_977.stay_duration: Up to 3 months on each visit
overall_validity: Life of passport if it expires in less than 12 months

visa_validity.extension_policy: Electronic travel authorities cannot be extended.
visa_validity.stay_extension_in_australia: To extend stay after arrival, a different visa must be applied for at least two weeks before the authority expires.

prohibited_activities: Entering Australia for the main purpose of work

general_obligations: Comply with all electronic travel authority conditions
specific_obligations: Be free from tuberculosis when entering Australia
Not perform work that an Australian citizen or permanent resident could do
Not study or train for more than three months
Not have any criminal convictions resulting in a total of 12 months or more imprisonment (regardless of time actually served)

change_notification_requirements.consequences_of_not_reporting_new_passpo: May experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board the plane.
